title: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

When cuda support is turned on spectacle will fail to compile with:

CMake Error at /nix/store/2r1vcpnld3nwpd1fs823xlawgw5j5c92-cmake-3.29.2/share/cmake-3.29/Modules/FindCUDA.cmake:883 (message):
  Specify CUDA_TOOLKIT_ROOT_DIR
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /nix/store/x09lf32h3g5cic6783mh2n0hxbq2h83a-opencv-4.9.0/lib/cmake/opencv4/OpenCVConfig.cmake:86 (find_package)
  /nix/store/x09lf32h3g5cic6783mh2n0hxbq2h83a-opencv-4.9.0/lib/cmake/opencv4/OpenCVConfig.cmake:108 (find_host_package)
  CMakeLists.txt:82 (find_package)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!

This adds the optional cuda build inputs needed to avoid that

items.title: spectacle: use minimal opencv

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://github.com/keepassxreboot/keepassxc/releases.

meta.description for keepassxc is: Offline password manager with many features.

meta.homepage for keepassxc is: https://keepassxc.org/

Updates performed
  • Version update
To inspect upstream changes

  • Release on GitHub

  • Compare changes on GitHub

Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • Warning: a test defined in passthru.tests did not pass
  • found 2.7.8 with grep in /nix/store/wcz85m9jkpbpnhgj4wrvg3mnf3p7rfqp-keepassxc-2.7.8
  • found 2.7.8 in filename of file in /nix/store/wcz85m9jkpbpnhgj4wrvg3mnf3p7rfqp-keepassxc-2.7.8
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

keepassxc
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/wcz85m9jkpbpnhgj4wrvg3mnf3p7rfqp-keepassxc-2.7.8 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A keepassxc https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/da93c33f4745d1fff713c81cd14978b41feb1a85.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/da93c33f4745d1fff713c81cd14978b41feb1a85#keepassxc

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/wcz85m9jkpbpnhgj4wrvg3mnf3p7rfqp-keepassxc-2.7.8
ls -la /nix/store/wcz85m9jkpbpnhgj4wrvg3mnf3p7rfqp-keepassxc-2.7.8/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

Result of nixpkgs-review --extra-nixpkgs-config '{ allowInsecurePredicate = x: true; }' run on x86_64-linux 1

1 package built:
  • keepassxc
Maintainer pings

cc @jonafato @BlankParticle for testing.
items.title: keepassxc: 2.7.7 -> 2.7.8

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Gate support for the gstreamer-device-provider behind the gstreamerSuppert flag. gstreamer-device-provider requires glib-2.0 as well as all the gstreamer dependences which are only pulled in when gstreamerSupport is enabled.

Resubmitting PR #280736 due to reviewers being added during rebase.

items.title: pipewire: fix build without gstreamer support

items.content_html:
Description of changes

In order to successfully connect bluetooth audio devices, pipewire must be running already which it might not when socketActivation is enabled.
-> disabling socketActivation is a better default as it provides the more stable user experience

items.title: nixos/pipewire: disable socket activation by default

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Since version 2.3.0, fluidsynth includes a pipewire audio driver. In fact, it's configured to build with pipewire driver support by default, but it needs to be able to find libpipewire during configuration of course. This PR just includes libpipewire so nix now builds fluidsynth with the pipewire driver.

(Note: I had hoped that including pipewire.lib in buildInputs would have worked, but only pipewire worked, not pipewire.lib.)

I wasn't able to run nixpkgs-review, since evulation took up so much memory it blew up my 32GB workstation.
